moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6 4. Bxc6 dxc6 5. d4 exd4 6. Qxd4 Bg4
comment: Black plays this move to exchange his Bishop for White Knight, breaking up White's King-side Pawns. However, after this exchange White will have an effective Pawn majority on the King-side against Black's ineffective one on the Queen-side. White can produce a passed Pawn in the resulting ending, while Black cannot force a passed Pawn with his Pawn majority on the other side. Black has a Bishop pair as a compensation for his Pawn weakness, which he can put to good use in open position.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6 4. Bxc6 dxc6 5. d4 exd4 6. Qxd4 Bg4 7. Nc3 Qxd4 8. Nxd4 O-O-O 9. Be3 Bb4 10. Ne2
comment: After 10 f3 Bc3+ 11 bc Bd7 12 Kf2 White would also have the better game, but, as opposite colored Bishops would be left after a possible exchange of Knights, Black would have drawing chances.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6 4. Bxc6 dxc6 5. d4 exd4 6. Qxd4 Bg4 7. Nc3 Qxd4 8. Nxd4 O-O-O 9. Be3 Bb4 10. Ne2 Bxe2
comment: Black gives up his only trump-the two Bishops-in order to saddle White with double Pawns; but his prospects on the Queen-side are in no way improved.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6 4. Bxc6 dxc6 5. d4 exd4 6. Qxd4 Bg4 7. Nc3 Qxd4 8. Nxd4 O-O-O 9. Be3 Bb4 10. Ne2 Bxe2 11. Kxe2 Bxc3 12. bxc3 Nf6 13. f3 Nd7 14. Rad1 Ne5 15. Rd4 b6 16. f4 Nd7 17. Rhd1 c5 18. R4d3 Nb8 19. Kf3 Rde8
comment: Black avoids exchange of Rooks with the hope of being able to meet the opposing Pawn advance in a better way but, his King is cut off for a long time from the King-side. Better was 19 ... Rd3 20 Rd3 Rd8 or 20 cd Kd7.

moves: 1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bb5 a6 4. Bxc6 dxc6 5. d4 exd4 6. Qxd4 Bg4 7. Nc3 Qxd4 8. Nxd4 O-O-O 9. Be3 Bb4 10. Ne2 Bxe2 11. Kxe2 Bxc3 12. bxc3 Nf6 13. f3 Nd7 14. Rad1 Ne5 15. Rd4 b6 16. f4 Nd7 17. Rhd1 c5 18. R4d3 Nb8 19. Kf3 Rde8 20. f5 f6 21. g4 Re7 22. Bf4 Rhe8 23. Re3 Nc6 24. g5 Na5
comment: If 24 ... fg 25 Bg5 Ne5+ 26 Kf4 Rd7 27 Rd5! and White can force the advance of his e-Pawn as 27 ... Rxd5? 28 ed wins a piece for White.
